textBox.richText: Apparently taking the ferry across the Atlantic from Nova Scotia to Newfoundland can be quite harrowing. Whales, ice bergs - you name it, you could see it. Heck we’re not that far from where the Titanic sunk and we’re sailing on the day of the 25th anniversary that the wreckage of the Titanic was found! Well... that drama aside our ferry crossing was quite uneventful as the weather was perfect and the sea was calm. We arrived in Newfoundland to a beautiful sunrise and more magical weather. Steph introduced us to her hometown of Stephenville (pronounced Steph - en - ville after Steph herself). It’s a small town blessed with scenic vistas and windy coastal roads. A slice of Tassie at the other side of the world!
